instructions.1: Preheat oven's broiler and set the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source.
instructions.2: Place beef tenderloin filets in a broiler pan and broil until slightly browned but still very rare, about 2 minutes per side. Remove the filets and set aside to rest; reduce heat to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
instructions.3: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and cook and stir shallot and garlic until the shallot is translucent, about 5 minutes.
instructions.4: Pour in Pinot Noir, bring to a boil, and cook until sauce is reduced by half, about 10 minutes, stirring often. Stir in garlic salt and Italian seasoning. Reduce heat to low.
instructions.5: Slowly stir cream cheese into the sauce until you get a creamy purple sauce. Remove the sauce from the heat.
instructions.6: Place puff pastry sheets on a work surface and cut each sheet in half crosswise.
instructions.7: Spoon a generous amount of sauce onto a puff pastry sheet half, and center a tenderloin filet onto the sauce.
instructions.8: Fold the puff pastry sheet over the steak and sauce, and press the edges all the way around to seal. Repeat with remaining steaks. Place the pastry-covered steaks onto a baking sheet.
instructions.9: Whisk the egg white and water in a bowl and brush the mixture over the tops of the pastry.
instructions.10: Bake in the oven until the pastry is browned and puffed and the steaks are the desired degree of doneness, about 25 minutes. An instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the center of the meat should read at least 145 degrees F (65 degrees C).

questions.question: In Step 7, is the sauce from Step 4 being used?

Is pastry from Step 9 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is sauce from Step 4 still available in Step 7?

Can we heat (Step 3) and spoon (Step 7) at the same time?
